abstract: Angela Scott's lovingly offbeat boots and heels don't sell by the thousands, and that's the way she likes it.
lead_paragraph: The designer Angela Scott's lovingly offbeat boots and heels don't sell by the thousands and can't be found in more than a handful of stores - Jeffrey in New York and Tomorrowland in Japan are two of them - but that's exactly how the Texas-based designer likes it. "I think there's something unique about a product that isn't overproduced," says Scott about her shoes, all of which are bench-made in small-batch factories by cobblers who hand-stitch and mold the vegetable-tanned leather and eco-friendly cork soles that characterize Scott's collection. "I'd love to just be in one shop, the best shop, in cities around the world. That would be a lovely place for me to sit," she says.

headline.main: Cobbled Together | The Office of Angela Scott
